|brand = TP-LINK |model = TL-WR1043 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = ND |revision = v1.x |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 01/04/2011 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/TP-Link_TL-WR1043ND_v1.0 |wlclass = N300 |series = TL-WR1043ND v1 |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = TE7WR1043NX |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = 2050500098 |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Atheros;AR9132;AR9132-BC1E; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24K |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 400 |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = STMicro;ST25P64V6P; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY5DU561622FTP-D43; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Realtek;RTL8366RB; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u/3ab |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 94:0C:6D, F8:D1:11 |oui = 94:0C:6D, F8:D1:11
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;;; |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, 4-pin header |jtag = yes,, 14-pin header
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = TP-LINK_XXXXXX |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |is_manuf = Yes |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, OpenWrt,
|availability = Discontinued |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 02/04/2010 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 845973051389 |ean = 6935364051389 |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- v2 B002YLAUU8 --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1chip2 = Atheros;AR9103; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = RP-SMA
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The '''TP-LINK''' logo, "11N Wireless Giga Router", and "REV: 1.0" :is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The default SSID is probably '''TP-LINK_XXXXXX''' where '''XXXXXX''' :are the last three octets of the router WLAN MAC.
There are multiple v1 revisions of this device. v1, v1.1, v1.4, v1.5, v1.6, v1.8
===PSU=== The power supply shown for the device in the FCC photos is a :'''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-A1 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A). :.. though, powering the device with voltage '''up to 15V''' :'''''may''''' be fine w/ the 12V -> 3.3V regulator on-board.
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.tp-link.com/resources/simulator/TL-WR1043ND/index.htm Firmware Interface]
===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=62217 Main thread for the device on the '''DD-WRT''' forum] *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=22742 Main thread for the device on the '''OpenWrt''' forum] :[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wr1043nd?s=wr1043nd Device entry on the '''OpenWrt''' wiki] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=148618 ''Canyon CNP-WF514N3A'' on the '''DD-WRT''' forum] (2050500107) :The [http://i442.photobucket.com/albums/qq143/SA924/CanyonRouter.jpg CANYON CNP-WF514N3A] is a TL-WR1043ND v1 (or equiv. OEM model).
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = WR1043ND v.24 SP2 - build 13972 - 20100223 :N clients connect only at G tx/rx rate, everything else working
Please insert instructions here
===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/tp-link/tp-link_tl-wr1043nd_v1 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wr1043nd |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 10.03.1 |current_supported_version = 22.03.5 |comment = }} Please insert instructions here
